channel.title: [PI] Mining breaks if you click away *FIXED*
channel.description:
The title really says all. If you're in mid action while mining and you click away (like to walk, or use another object, etc) it doesn't allow you to mine again unless you change regions. How would I go about fixing this?
Fixed. Thank you runescape sucks and ohokay.

item.title: [PI] Mining breaks if you click away *FIXED*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

runescape sucks:

Well, when said player starts mining, can he click the rock again? Will it repeat the same message as if he had just started mining, and the entire method? If so, you have to stop the method in the packet that handles walking away.

There’s no actual message, and I didn’t check if it does.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Mining breaks if you click away *FIXED*

item.title: [PI] Mining breaks if you click away *FIXED*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:2, topic:512968”]Is that because of how the object is replaced?

You could make it so the player can’t walk mid-animation. That would solve the issue.

But you need to try and find where the problem is caused, then maybe people can help out.[/quote]
Well, how would I go about making it not possible to walk during animation.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Mining breaks if you click away *FIXED*
